response_parsed.title: Harden Stream Processing with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to leverage FastAPI and Python 3.12+'s features to secure and optimize stream processing applications.
key_points: Utilize the FastAPI framework for building robust, high-performance APIs in Python 3.12+
Implement Middleware for handling authentication, rate limiting, error handling, and logging
Use AsyncIO to optimize stream processing performance
Leverage FastAPI's built-in security features such as OpenAPI security schemes, JWT authentication, and rate limiting
Optimize stream processing by breaking the data into smaller chunks and processing them concurrently

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, Depends
app = FastAPI()
def my_async_function(data: str):
    # Your stream processing code here
async def main():
    while True:
        data = await get_stream_data()
        await my_async_function(data)
        await some_other_async_task()
if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run(main=main)

FastAPI version 0.70+ is recommended to take advantage of the latest features
caveats: Ensure proper error handling and exception propagation when dealing with asynchronous functions
Monitor resource usage carefully while processing large amounts of data in memory or streams
Implement caching strategies if necessary to reduce API response times during high traffic situations
